gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Children, Ages 5 to 17, from Families in Poverty in 2013, by 2013-2014 School District: Indiana, 2015

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (creator)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: CHILDREN_POVERTY_2013_USCB_IN.SHP is a polygon shapefile showing 2013 census data showing percentages of children in poverty for each 2013-2014 school district within Indiana. Poverty data were provided by personnel of the Indiana Business Research Center (Rachel Strange, Geodemographic Analyst, Managing Editor, IBRC), which were obtained from the Web page of the U. S. Department of Commerce, U. S. Census Bureau, titled Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates, . Discussion of these data, which are estimates produced under the Census Bureau's Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates (SAIPE) program, are provided at . The following is excerpted from metata of the U.S. Census Bureau (2013-2014 School Districts) and also from the Web page of the SAIPE program ( http://www.census.gov/did/www/saipe/downloads/sd13/README.txt ) : School Districts are single-purpose administrative units within which local officials provide public educational services for the area's residents. The Census Bureau obtains school district boundaries, names, local education agency codes, grade ranges, and school district levels biennially from state school officials. The Census Bureau collects this information for the primary purpose of providing the U.S. Department of Education with annual estimates of the number of children in poverty within each school district, county, and state. This information serves as the basis for the Department of Education to determine the annual allocation of Title I funding to states and school districts. The 2014 TIGER/Line Shapefiles include separate shapefiles for elementary, secondary, and unified school districts. The 2014 shapefiles contain information from the 2013-2014 school year. The 2013-2014 school districts represent districts in operation as of January 1, 2014. The elementary school districts provide education to the lower grade/age levels and the secondary school districts provide education to the upper grade/age levels. The unified school districts are districts that provide education to children of all school ages. In general, where there is a unified school district, no elementary or secondary school district exists (see exceptions described below), and where there is an elementary school district the secondary school district may or may not exist (see explanation below). The U.S. Census Bureau's Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates (SAIPE) program provides annual estimates of income and poverty statistics for all school districts, counties, and states. The main objective of this program is to provide estimates of income and poverty for the administration of federal programs and the allocation of federal funds to local jurisdictions. In addition to these federal programs, state and local programs use the income and poverty estimates for distributing funds and managing programs. The SAIPE program produces the following county and state estimates: Total number of people in poverty. Number of childer under age 5 in poevery (for states only). Number of related children ages 5 to 17 in families in poverty. Number of children under age 18 in poverty. Median household income.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: CHILDREN_POVERTY_2013_USCB_IN.SHP was created to provide a GIS data layer showing percentages of children from families in poverty as of 2013, by 2013-2014 school districts within Indiana.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: U. S. Department of Commerce, U. S. Census Bureau, the Indiana Business Research Center, and the Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcCatalog version 10.2 shapefile format, approximately 3.7 Mb

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on information contained in technical documentation from the U.S. Census Bureau, and the SAIPE Program

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be topologically accurate and complete.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be topologically accurate and complete.
This data set was provided by the U. S. Census Bureau and is assumed to be complete.

No formal metadata in the format of the Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC) was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the source data for this shapefile. For a more detailed discussion of how the U.S. Census Bureau created these data, please access the USCB technical documents for 2014 school districts data found at the following URL: http://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/data/tiger-line.html
No information was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the horizontal positional accuracy of the source data.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this data.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: IGS personnel downloaded the file named "tl_2014_18_unsd.SHP" from the U.S. Census Bureau Web site for 2014 TIGER/Line Shapefiles ( http://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/data/tiger-line.html ). The shapefile was loaded into ESRI ArcMap 10.2 and examined for completeness, attribute accuracy, and spatial accuracy. The shapefile was then reprojected into the Transverse Mercator projection and UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983 coordinate system. The fields named "INTPTLAT," "INTPTLON," and "SDTYP" were deleted from the attribute table. Data from ChildPoverty2013.xlsx was then joined to the school district polygons using the field named "GEOID." The shapefile was then renamed "CHILDREN_POVERTY_2013_USCB_IN.SHP" to conform to the internal file-naming conventions of the IGS.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
2013-2014 Unified school districts in Indiana from 2014 TIGER/Line shapefiles

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: tl_2014_18_unsd.SHP (2013-2014 Unified School Districts of Indiana from 2014 TIGER/Line shapefiles)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (USCB)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Data is from U.S.Census Bureau, 2014 TIGER/Line shapefiles.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on metadata provided by USCB for the source shapefile tl_2014_18_unsd.SHP.

Estimated percentages of children in poverty in 2013, to be appended to the unified school districts districts (2013-2014 school year) for Indiana from the 2014 edition of the USCB TIGER/Line shapefiles.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Business Research Center (IBRC) processed SAIPE data from USCB

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Data is originally from the SAIPE program of the U.S.Census Bureau.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Based on communications with IBRC personnel

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
